title: Driver without a wing mirror puts his mobile into selfie mode to help him reverse
text:
A driver used selfie-mode on his phone to reverse a concrete mixer down a residential street as he had no wing mirror.

In the bizarre clip, the orange concrete truck makes a right-hand bend in Erith, Greater London, before stopping abruptly.

The driver, who is filming the moment, stops their vehicle and gives the lorry enough space to pull into the side or head in the other direction.

A driver abruptly stops his lorry (pictured left), which is carrying cement mixer, and fishes out his mobile phone before balancing it in selfie-mode to get a view of the road so he can reverse (pictured right)

But the concrete mixer's driver then pulls out his phone and holds it outside his mirror, in what appears to be a good view for seeing behind his vehicle on the street.

As he nonchalantly whips out his device, it would appear as though he had planned to use it or has done before.

He then tilts it side-ways to get a wider look for driving backwards, in the clip posted on October 9.

He steers the wheel while balancing his right arm on the open window, holding his phone, in the dashcam footage shared on October 9

The vehicle gradually makes it way down the residential street and avoids making any eye contact or interaction with the driver who shot the video

They confidently snake their way backwards on the road which luckily appears empty apart from a few parked cars

Moments later, the clip zooms in and shows the driver fiddling with his mobile before finally deciding to rest his arm on the open window with the phone.

He steers the wheel in his other hand and makes a confident reverse - narrowly missing a curb and making his way up the street.

Meanwhile he keeps his eyes peeled on the small screen in front of him, instead of making any interaction with the waiting car in front of him.
description: A driver has used his phone in selfie-mode to reverse his cement-mixer down a residential street in Erith, Greater London, in clip posted on October 9. Keeps his eyes fixed on his phone in dashcam clip.
